embeds.title: Undervolt
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton / Downfall

ALL enemies lose 2 (3) **Strength** :p_strength:.
Gain 2 Burns.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: a really good card imo
auto can deal with statuses
<its a feature> <bug barrage>

embeds.title: It's a Feature
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you draw a **Curse** or **Status** card, gain 1 temporary :p_temp: **Strength** :p_strength: and **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

embeds.title: Bug Barrage
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton / Downfall

Gain 1 (2) Wound (Wounds).
**Cycle** each **Status**, dealing 7 damage for each.

messages.content: It's extremely powerful when used with bug barrage in hand
also it has partial synergy with <philosofize> since it mitigates its downside

embeds.title: Virus
embeds.description:

**Retain**.
Deal 5 (6) damage.

messages.content: the retain on virus just makes undervolt so incredibly good
That's also true
It's also a good fuel for <burn out> no matter if you use it on the same turn or after discarding the burs

embeds.title: Burn Out
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton / Downfall

Deal 6 (9) damage to a random enemy for ALL of your **Status** cards, then **Exhaust** them.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: One thing I especially like about auto status decks is that generating statuses feels like   fueling a powerful engine turning them into a secondary resource that you have to manage
Hermit does a similar thing with curses but the "engine" doesn't run as smooth as with auto and is prone to breaking
That and it can gain strength a lot easier than heart can.

The reality is that enough of the most difficult fights in the game are either AOE or involve multi-hit enemies (gremlin leader, snake plant, book of stabbing, nemesis, tri slavers, etc) that a card like this will just be inherently excellent. Disarm, piercing wail, dark shackles, and malaise are all very helpful in nearly all circumstances. The closest comparison for this card is hermits flash powder, which is also AOE strength reduction for 1 cost, and blocks for a little bit. The addition of the burns here actually makes for some very nice synergies with bug barrage, virus, mutator, and others. If anything, I think that undervolt is too good, between the inherent power of strength down cards and the synergies with it's own status package, It's hard to imagine not wanting to take undervolt when you see it.
also - strength against all watcher fights is nice

This card is fine. It has a weird niche where it both benefits you for the duration of an entire fight but also hurts you by giving you two burns. If your deck can acutally use the burns then this card is great, but without direct status synergy this card under delivers compared to the other block cards automation can take or create.

since when your deck cannot deal with burns, this is a block card that has the downside of doing at minimum 4 damage to you; often more and thats on top of hurting your draws later. Compared to something like disarm which has no drawbacks other then artifact existing (also the heart not existing matters a lot since you often take disarms just for the heart and accept everything else as a bonus)

yeah I think this card is okay; it's intensely good if you get specific combos out. In reality, I think it's just auto's bomb cards are incredibly bomb in all situations; deck cycling/exhausting and draw has always been strong, and auto has one of the best of all of these worlds in so many cards

status decks for auto I think are okay where they are, just simply because you can ruin yourself if you invest too much without having a good way of dealing with status generation; and even then dealing with over saturation of status cards requires ramp which takes turns
Yeah and you deal with the issue that as you have more statuses, the more likely it is you draw dead on a turn and eat 57 damage from reptomancer
